Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: JOB IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to the wireline log job.
Column Comment.3: TRIP OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique number assigned to the data related to awell log trip. If unique run numbers exist, they may be used if desired. If not, asurrogate component is created.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the bottom of the logged interval.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LOG CURVE TYPE: Identifies the type of wireline log curve recorded during thelogging operation. For example, caliper, gamma ray.
Column Comment.11: MAXIMUM DEPTH: Maximum depth reached by the survey or test tool during the logrun.
Column Comment.12: MAXIMUM DEPTH OUOM: Maximum depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE: Value for the maximum temperature in the boreholeduring this trip.
Column Comment.14: MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE OUOM: Maximum temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.15: MUD SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to each mud sample in thewell.
Column Comment.16: MUD SAMPLE TYPE: The type of mud sample used in determining mud resistivity.For example mud cake, filtrate, mud...
Column Comment.17: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.18: OBSERVER: the person who witnessed the wireline operations.
Column Comment.19: ON BOTTOM DATE: Date the logging tool reached the bottom of the wellbore.
Column Comment.20: ON BOTTOM TIME: Time of day the logging tool reached the bottom of the wellbore.
Column Comment.21: ON BOTTOM TIMEZONE: The timezone of ON_BOTTOM_TIME.
Column Comment.22: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional survey andmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.25: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.26: REPORTED APD: The height of the log datum above the reported permanent datum,as reported by the source of this row. Reference APD in LAS format. To adjust areported depth to the reported permanent datum, compute e.g. LOG DATUM ELEV -PERMANENT DATUM ELEV.
Column Comment.27: REPORTED LOG DATUM: The datum from which the log depths are measured. Thepoint at which log depth equals zero, e.g. kelly bushing. Reference DREF in LASformat.
Column Comment.28: REPORTED LOG DATUM ELEV): The elevation of the LOG_DATUM, as reported bythe source of this row. Reference EREF in LAS format.
Column Comment.29: REPORTED LOG DATUM ELEVATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.30: REPORTED LOG RUN: Reported value indicating the run number of the log job trip .A sequence number usually assigned by the contractor indicating a particular set oflog operations run in a wellbore on or about the same date. The log run for a wellmay not be known or unique, so this column was removed from the PK in PPDM 3.7.
Column Comment.31: REPORT_PERM_DATUM: The permanent datum as reported by the source of thisrow. Reference PDAT in LAS format. Generally, this value should be the same asWELL.WELL_DEPTH_DATUM, but in rare cases it may be different.
Column Comment.32: REPORT_PERM_DATUM_ELEV: The reported elevation of the permanent datum.This should be the same as WELL.DEPTH_DATUM_ELEV, but in rare cases it maybe different. Reference EPD in LAS.
Column Comment.33: REPORTED PERMANENT DATUM ELEVATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.34: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.35: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface datum to the top of the loggedinterval.
Column Comment.36: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.37: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.38: TRIP DATE: Date the logging tools entered the borehole for this trip.
Column Comment.39: TUBING BOTTOM DEPTH: Depth measured at the bottom of the tubing by thelogger.
Column Comment.40: TUBING BOTTOM DEPTH OUOM: Tubing bottom depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
